paragraphs.content: Chapter 2
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 2

paragraphs.content: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

paragraphs.content: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

paragraphs.content: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

paragraphs.content: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

paragraphs.content: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

paragraphs.content: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

paragraphs.content: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:
paragraphs.contentHtml: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

paragraphs.content: But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,
paragraphs.contentHtml: But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

paragraphs.content: Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;

paragraphs.content: But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:
paragraphs.contentHtml: But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:

paragraphs.content: For there is no respect of persons with God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there is no respect of persons with God.

paragraphs.content: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

paragraphs.content: (For not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.
paragraphs.contentHtml: (For not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

paragraphs.content: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:

paragraphs.content: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

paragraphs.content: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

paragraphs.content: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,

paragraphs.content: And knowest his will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And knowest his will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

paragraphs.content: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

paragraphs.content: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.

paragraphs.content: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

paragraphs.content: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

paragraphs.content: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?

paragraphs.content: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

paragraphs.content: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

paragraphs.content: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

paragraphs.content: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?

paragraphs.content: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

paragraphs.content: But he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
